cluster_relations.rel_desc: Caterpillars display a variety of body shapes.
Caterpillars display a range of body sizes.
Caterpillars display a variety of body colors.
Some caterpillars possess spines on their bodies.
Some caterpillars possess hairs that serve as protective structures.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that a taxon or organism group shows variation across individuals or species in a specific morphological attribute or dimension (e.g., shape, size, color).
args.justification: All three relations describe caterpillars displaying a variety of morphological attributes (shapes, sizes, colors) depending on species, i.e., variation in morphology rather than a single fixed trait. A single predicate capturing variation in a specific morphological dimension fits all three instances.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that an organism or body part possesses a particular anatomical structure as one of its parts.
args.justification: Both relations state that caterpillars possess specific physical defensive structures (spines, hairs). This is a standard part–whole anatomical relationship and is best modeled as an organism having an anatomical structure.

These relations connect caterpillars to morphological attributes (shape, size, color) and describe how these attributes vary. Grouping them under a morphology-focused attribute class provides a reusable family for similar organism–morphology links.

These relations capture that caterpillars possess particular anatomical structures (spines, hairs). A dedicated class for anatomical/part-structure relations is appropriate and reusable for other organism–structure edges.

The relations describe variation in attributes (shape, size, color) of caterpillars, not composition or causality. A broad ATTRIBUTE group best captures that these are about descriptive properties of the subject.

The relations state that caterpillars possess spines or hairs as physical parts of their bodies, which is a classic part–whole/anatomical containment relation rather than a causal or purely descriptive attribute.
